subject: AI & Agents
title: Pooling: Shrinking Feature Maps
description: A quick, practical guide to Pooling: Shrinking Feature Maps.

hook.text: After convolution, your feature map is huge. Pooling compresses it.

buildup.text: Max pooling takes the maximum value in each small patch, reducing spatial dimensions.

discovery.text: Pooling makes the network translation-invariantâ€”a cat is a cat regardless of position.

twist.text: Modern architectures often use strided convolutions instead of pooling for better results.

climax.text: Pooling trades spatial detail for efficiency. For dense tasks like segmentation, you want it back.

quiz.question: What does max pooling do?
options: Takes the maximum value in each patch to reduce spatial size
